settings.title: London Bridge Grind
settings.text: London Bridge Grind is a buzzing riverside cocktail bar, espresso bar and all-day restaurant just above the famous Borough Market.

Bookings & Reservations.
Reservations at London Bridge Grind can be made online above or by calling 020 3019 7178. For parties larger than 6, email us to book. Please note, we can only hold your reservation for 10 minutes, and can only seat you once everyone has arrived.

At all times, we keep a few tables free for walk-ins. You might have to wait if we’re particularly busy, but we’ll do our best to find you a table as quickly as possible.

Breakfast - Monday to Sunday, Opening-12pm.

Lunch - Monday to Friday, Midday-5pm. 

Dinner - Monday to Saturday, 5pm-Close. 

Weekend Brunch - Saturdays, Midday-5pm - Sundays, Midday-6pm.
Weekend brunch bookings can be made online for up to six people, the table is yours for up to 90 minutes. 

Children.
Children are welcome in London Grind until 6pm.

Please note baby changing and high chair facilities are not available at this location.

settings.richText:
This Privacy Policy is effective 25th May 2018.

This Privacy Policy aims to give you information on how we collect and process your personal data.

The Grind locations, website, mobile app and any other means of collecting personal data are controlled by Grind & Co. Limited, referred to as “we”, “us” or “our” throughout this Privacy Policy.

We are the primary data controller for the purposes of this website and our registered office is Grind, 8-10 New North Place, Shoreditch, EC2A 4JA, United Kingdom.

We may amend this Privacy Policy at any time by posting the amended terms herein. All amended terms automatically take effect 30 days after they are posted.

This Privacy Policy describes our collection, use, disclosure, retention and protection of your personal data. It applies to anywhere we collect your data where this Privacy Policy appears.

By navigating to a Grind website or mobile view, by transacting and by registering an account, you are agreeing to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

Grind & Co. Limited is the data controller of your personal data and is responsible for the collection, use, disclosure, retention and protection of your personal information in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation. 

Grind & Co. Limited may transfer your personal information outside of the European Economic Area to our group companies and authorised third parties. Where we use third party service providers based outside of the European Economic Area, we may use specific contracts approved by the European Commission which give personal data the same protection it has in Europe. Where we use third party service providers based in the US, we may transfer data to them if they are part of the Privacy Shield which requires them to provide similar protection to personal data shared between the Europe and the US.

We may collect, process and retain personal information from you and any devices you may use;

When you navigate to a Grind web view or mobile view

When you make a transaction with us in store, online, or on our mobile app

When you register an account with us

When you provide it to us when you use our services

We may also collect personal information from you if you physically enter one of our stores. The personal information we collect includes the personal information;

That you provide us when you register a Grind Card through our loyalty program

That you give us when you make a transaction with us in store, online, or on our mobile app

That you provide when you register an account with us

That you provide when interacting with our customer services team including details we require to contact you and verify your identity Device identifiers such as IP addresses, cookie IDs, IDFAs and other device identifiers

Geo location information, IoT technologies and connection information such as statistics on your page views, traffic to and from the sites, ad data and referral URL

If you give us personal data about someone else, you must do so only with their explicit and prior consent.

We may use cookies, web beacons and similar technologies to collect information about the pages you view, the actions you take on our services and within our e-mail content.

We may use your information;

When we process orders your make When we provide you with customer service

When we customise, measure and Improve our services

When we provide you with editorial content

In order to detect, prevent, mitigate and investigate fraudulent or illegal activities

In order to provide other services requested by you as described when we collect the information

Where there is a legitimate business interest or a reasonable expectation to do so, we shall use and retain your personal information to contact you via email, social media or postal mail in order to inform you of account activity, delivery fulfilment and marketing activity. 

We retain your personal information as long as it is necessary or relevant . After it is no longer relevant for us to retain your personal information, we dispose of it securely according to our data retention and deletion policies.

When we determine the maximum retention duration of any personal data we hold we do so with regard to our legitimate interests to retain data, our obligation under GDPR to minimise data we hold with what we do hold as personal data being kept proportionate; the nature, and sensitivity of the personal data and the potential risk of harm from unauthorised use or disclosure of your personal data.

The General Data Protection Regulation provides for rights of access, modification and deletion of your personal information.

These include your rights to;

Access and obtain a copy of your data on request

Require the business to change incorrect or incomplete data

Require the business to delete or stop processing your data

Object to the use of your data where the business' legitimate interests are the grounds for use

You can submit requests for this at support@grind.co.uk or at Grind, 8-10 New North Place, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 4JA.
If you do not wish to receive editorial communications from us, you can unsubscribe with the link in any email you have received.

We may disclose your personal information to authorised third party service providers who help us to provide our services, these include but are not limited to;

When we require a payment payment providers to facilitate a purchase

When we require a fulfilment provider to facilitate order management and delivery

When we require an email provider to facilitate our editorial content

We minimise the amount of personal information we disclose to what is directly relevant and necessary to accomplish the specified purpose.

We protect your information using measures that reduce the risks of loss, misuse, unauthorised access, disclosure and alteration. We require all third parties to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law. We do not allow our third-party service providers to use your personal data for their own purposes and only permit them to process your personal data for specified purposes and in specific accordance with our instructions. 

Where legally compelling grounds exist, we may also disclose your personal information to the government and to law enforcement, and otherwise in the defence of legal claims. 

If we were to be acquired by another company, we may share information with them however we will require that company to agree follow this Privacy Policy with respect to your personal information.

If you have a question about this Privacy Policy, you can get in touch with us at support@grind.co.uk or at Grind, 8-10 New North Place, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 4JA.

It is important that the personal data we hold about you is accurate and current. Please keep us informed if your personal data changes during your relationship with us.

Terms & Conditions.

Terms of Service. Grind Coffee Roasters Limited is registered in England and Wales under company number12257877.

Our registered office is at Grind HQ, 8-10 New North Place, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 4JA, United Kingdom. This is not an address for returns.

Background.

This agreement applies as between you, the User of this Website and Grind Coffee Roasters Limited (trading as ‘Grind’), the owner(s) of this Website. Your agreement to comply with and be bound by these Terms and Conditions is deemed to occur upon your first use of the Website. If you do not agree to be bound by these Terms and Conditions, you should stop using the Website immediately. No part of this Website is intended to constitute a contractual offer capable of acceptance. Your order constitutes a contractual offer and our acceptance of that offer is deemed to occur upon our sending a dispatch email to you indicating that your order has been fulfilled and is on its way to you.

1. Definitions and Interpretation

In this Agreement the following terms shall have the following meanings: 

“Account”

means collectively the personal information, Payment Information and credentials used by Users to access Paid Content and / or any communications System on the Website;

“Carrier”

“Grind”

means Grind Coffee Roasters Limited, company number 12257877.

“Service”

“Payment Information”

means any details required for the purchase of Goods from this Website. This includes, but is not limited to, credit / debit card numbers, bank account numbers and sort codes;

“Purchase Information”

means collectively any orders, invoices, dispatch notes, receipts or similar that may be in hard copy or electronic form;

“Premises”

Means our place(s) of business located at 8-10 New North Place, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 4JA;

“System”

means any online communications infrastructure that Grind makes available through the Website either now or in the future. This includes, but is not limited to, web-based email, message boards, live chat facilities and email links;

“User” / “Users”

means any third party that accesses the Website and is not employed by Grind and acting in the course of their employment; and

“Website”

means the website that you are currently using (http://grind.co.uk) and any sub-domains of this site (e.g. subdomain.grind.co.uk) unless expressly excluded by their own terms and conditions.

2. Age Restrictions

Persons under the age of 18 should use this Website only with the supervision of an Adult. Payment Information must be provided by or with the permission of an Adult.

3. Business Customers

These Terms and Conditions do not apply to customers buying Goods in the course of business.

4. International Customers 

If Goods are being ordered from outside Grind's country of residence (United Kingdom), import duties and taxes may be incurred once your Goods reach their destination. Grind is not responsible for these charges and we undertake to make no calculations or estimates in this regard. If you are buying internationally, you are advised to contact your local customs authorities for further details on costs and procedures. As the purchaser of the Goods, you will also be the importer of record and as such should ensure that your purchase is in full compliance with the laws of the country into which the Goods are being imported. Please be aware that Goods may be inspected on arrival at port for customs purposes and Grind cannot guarantee that the packaging of your Goods will be free of signs of tampering.

5. Intellectual Property

5.2 Subject to Clause 7 you may not reproduce, copy, distribute, store or in any other fashion re-use material from the Website unless otherwise indicated on the Website or unless given express written permission to do so by Grind.

6.2 Subject to Clause 7 you may not reproduce, copy, distribute, store or in any other fashion re-use such material unless otherwise indicated on the Website or unless given express written permission to do so by the relevant manufacturer or supplier.

7. Fair Use of Intellectual Property

Material from the Website may be re-used without written permission where any of the exceptions detailed in Chapter III of the Copyright Designs and Patents Act 1988 apply.

8. Links to Other Websites

9. Links to this Website

Deep linking (i.e. links to specific pages within the site) requires the express permission of Grind. To find out more please contact us by email at hello@grind.co.uk

10. Use of Communications Facilities

10.1 When using the enquiry form or any other System on the Website you should do so in accordance with the following rules:

10.1.1 You must not use obscene or vulgar language;

10.1.2 You must not submit Content that is unlawful or otherwise objectionable. This includes, but is not limited to, Content that is abusive, threatening, harassing, defamatory, ageist, sexist or racist;

10.1.6 You must not impersonate other people, particularly employees and representatives of Grind or our affiliates; and

11. Accounts

11.1 In order to purchase Goods on this Website and to use the enquiry form facilities you are required to create an Account which will contain certain personal details and Payment Information which may vary based upon your use of the Website as we may not require payment information until you wish to make a purchase. 14.1 Grind will notify you by way of email when your goods are to be dispatched to you. The message will contain details of estimated delivery times in addition to any reasons for a delay in the delivery of the Goods purchased by you.

14.3 For international shipments the customer is regarded as the importer and responsible for all laws and regulations of the country receiving the goods and responsible for any import duties or taxes

15. Returns Policy

Grind aims to always provide high quality Goods that are fault free and undamaged. On occasion however, goods may need to be returned. Returns are governed by these Terms and Conditions. 

15.1 If you receive Goods which do not match those that you ordered, unless accompanied by an explanatory note detailing the changes, stating reasons for the changes and setting out your options, you should contact us within 14 days to arrange collection and return. Grind is not responsible for paying shipment costs. You will be given the option to have the Goods replaced with those ordered (if available) or to be refunded through the payment method used by you when purchasing the Goods. Refunds and replacements will be issued upon our receipt of the returned Goods.

15.2 If any Goods you have purchased have faults when they are delivered to you, you should contact Grind within 28 days to arrange collection and return. Grind is not responsible for paying shipment costs. Goods must be returned in their original condition with all packaging and documentation. Upon receipt of the returned Goods, the price of the Goods, as paid by you, will be refunded to you through the payment method used by you when purchasing the Goods.

15.3 If Goods are damaged in transit and the damage is apparent on delivery, you should sign the delivery note to the effect that the goods have been damaged. 15.4 You have a statutory right to a “cooling off” period. This period begins once your order is complete and ends 7 working days after the Goods have been delivered. 15.5 If you wish to return Goods to Grind for any of the above reasons, please contact us using hello@grind.co.uk or check http://grind.co.uk for upto date and alternative methods of arranging the return of Goods and to make the appropriate arrangements. 15.6 Grind reserves the right to exercise discretion with respect to any returns under these Terms and Conditions. Factors which may be taken into account in the exercise of this discretion include, but are not limited to:

15.6.4 Any discounts that may have formed part of the purchase price of the Goods to reflect any lack of quality made known to the Customer at the time of purchase. 

Such discretion to be exercised only within the confines of the law.

16. Privacy

17. Disclaimers

18. Changes to the Service and these Terms and Conditions

20. Limitation of Liability

Users should be aware that they use the Website and its Content at their own risk.

20.4 Whilst every effort has been made to ensure that these Terms and Conditions adhere strictly with the relevant provisions of the Unfair Contract Terms Act 1977, in the event that any of these terms are found to be unlawful, invalid or otherwise unenforceable, that term is to be deemed severed from these Terms and Conditions and shall not affect the validity and enforceability of the remaining Terms and Conditions. This term shall apply only within jurisdictions where a particular term is illegal.

21. No Waiver

22. Previous Terms and Conditions

23. Third Party Rights

Nothing in these Terms and Conditions shall confer any rights upon any third party. The agreement created by these Terms and Conditions is between you and Grind.

24. Communications

24.1 All notices / communications shall be given to us either by post to our Premises (see address above) or by email to hello@grind.co.uk. Such notice will be deemed received 3 days after posting if sent by first class post, the day of sending if the email is received in full on a business day and on the next business day if the email is sent on a weekend or public holiday.

24.2 Grind may from time to time send you information about our products and/or services. If you do not wish to receive such information, please click on the Unsubscribe link in any email which you receive from us.

settings.pageTitle: Terms and Conditions  for the Urban Decay x Grind comment-to-win prize draw promotion

settings.richText:
Terms and Conditions.

UK residents 18+. Entries open 00:01 (UK time) on 24 June 2021 until 23:59 (UK time) on 15 July 2021. For your chance to win, follow @grind and @UrbanDecayUKI on Instagram, post a comment of a purple heart emoji and tag a friend in response to the Instagram post: [insert hyperlink]. Prize is: 1x Grind One Coffee Machine, 1x Grind Milk Frother, 1x 12-month Grind coffee subscription; and a bundle of Urban Decay make-up products worth at least £500. Full T&Cs. Promoters: Urban Decay and Grind.


By entering the promotion, you agree to be bound by these terms and conditions (these "Terms and Conditions").  Promotional materials relating to the promotion, including all information on how to enter the promotion, also form part of these Terms and Conditions.  In the event of any conflict between any terms referred to in such promotion materials and these Terms and Conditions, these Terms and Conditions take precedence.

The winner will receive:
- 1x Grind One Coffee Machine
- 1x Grind milk Frother
- 1x 12-month Grind coffee subscription
- A bundle of Urban Decay products worth a minimum of £500 including 1x All Nighter Setting Spray, 1x All Nighter Setting Spray Ultra Glow, 1x All Nighter Setting Spray Ultra Matte, 1x Vice Lipstick in Backtalk, 1x Vice Lipstick in 714, 1x Eyeshadow Primer lotion, 1x Wild West Pallet, 1x Naked Reloaded Pallet, 1x Naked Honey Pallet, 1x Naked Cherry Pallet, 1x Naked Ultraviolet Pallet, 1x Naked Heat Pallet, 1x Tube of All Nighter Face Primer, 1x Tube of All Nighter Ultra Glow Primer, 1x Subversion, 1x Perversion Mascara, 1x Lash Freak Mascara.

The winner will be able to choose either ground coffee, whole bean coffee or coffee pods for their Grind 12-month coffee subscription. One tin of
ground coffee (227g), one bag of whole beans (227g) or one box with 30 pods will be sent to the winner every month for 12 months.

Privacy Policy: https://grind.co.uk/pages/privacy and https://privacy.loreal.com/UKI/

We know that Grind is only as good as the people who work for us, and we’re always on the lookout for talented & passionate baristas, managers, chefs, bar and service staff to join our growing business. Since 2011 we've built our reputation for making amazing coffee, cocktails and food to a great soundtrack, and we've loved every minute of it.

Whether you're looking for the opportunity for a new career or just a rewarding part-time job, we'd love to discuss your place in our rapidly expanding company.

When we launched our crowdfunding campaign in summer 2015, our central promise was to build a state of the art coffee roastery to supply coffee to our locations around London. One year later, we delivered on that promise, opening our state of the art roastery in a converted warehouse in the heart of Shoreditch. In 2019, we relocated our Roastery from Shoreditch to Elephant and Castle, into a facility five times the size of our original Roastery. 

From our Roastery, Head Roaster Howard works with his team, and Grind Head of Coffee Sam to taste, select, and roast the coffee before it’s packed and delivered to our locations around London each week. Howard and Sam work closely with a team of boutique importers, guaranteeing fair pay to farmers, as well as investing in projects to improve the communities that they rely so much on.

settings.textOne:
We love your coffee - do you do wholesale?
If your business is interested in starting up a wholesale account with us, then please send across your enquiry to wholesale@grind.co.uk. In order to give you the best price, do try to include the volume of coffee - or coffee pods - you think you'll be ordering.

I’m looking to buy a gift card - which one should I buy?
Through our website you can order virtual and physical gift cards. Virtual gift cards are sent instantly by email and contain instructions to redeem them, these gift cards have no postage fees and can only be redeemed on purchases made through our website. Physical gift cards can be used in any Grind across London - these cards are delivered in a small pink package, with space for a message of your choice.

Can I subscribe?
Our subscriptions are designed to be as accommodating as possible - pick your blend and how much you'd like delivered each month. You can edit, pause or cancel your subscription at any time at grind.co.uk. Any questions? Get in touch at shop@grind.co.uk

What machines are your Grind pods compatible with?
Our pods are the Original style Nespresso capsule and will work with almost all Nespresso-compatible machines. If you’re unsure if our pods will work in your coffee machine please feel free to drop us an email to shop@grind.co.uk.

What does compostable really mean?
Our coffee pods are made of biodegradable bioplastic, while the lid is made of PLA and paper. Grind at Home is also 100% plastic free. Our tins are recyclable, and our pods and packaging are certified compostable or recyclable.

Our pods take six weeks to break down in industrial compost, but do take longer in home compost. In our home composting tests we found the pods decomposed in just over 12 weeks, however this can vary as your home compost, like you, is completely unique.

Is your coffee organic?
The coffee we use in our compostable pods, and that's available online, is organic. In-store, lots of our coffees are organic, but not all of them. It's very difficult to register for the certification, and lots of the farms we work with are too small to afford the certification. Almost all of these farms are family-run - with many existing for several generations - meaning that sustainability is core to their livelihood.

Is your coffee Fairtrade?
We work directly with farms around the world and pay them far above the "Fairtrade" price, typically around double. For us it's about 'trade, not aid' and by paying a fair price for some of the world's best coffee, and encouraging farmers to focus on quality, not quantity, we are building long term sustainable partnerships that benefit everyone involved.

How do I make the perfect coffee with your Grind ground coffee?
There are many great ways to brew our ground coffee - the most important thing is to get the ratio of coffee to water correct, so we recommend buying some micro scales and then using a Hario v60.
For one cup of coffee add 16g of coffee and slowly pour over 250ml of water, stirring at intervals.
For French Press, use the same recipe - just let the water and coffee sit together for 4 minutes before you pour!

Which grinder would you recommend?
There are lots of options - depending on how much you want to spend! We recommend;
- The Rhino Hand Grinder - a little labour intensive but great for filter coffees, and easily adjustable.
- The Wilfa Coffee Grinder - really easy to use, electronic so no muscles required!

What's the difference between your House Blend and Light Blend?
Our House Blend is designed to be sweet, chocolatey and nutty - perfect for drinking with milk. We serve it every day at every Grind, in all our drinks with milk. Our Light Blend is roasted specifically for black coffee or espresso, and is more fruity and complex, while still sweet and balanced.

Can I use your ground coffee with my cafetière / drip filter machine / stovetop / espresso machines / dishwasher / spacecraft?
Our ground coffee is a general purpose grind, which works really well for filter coffees - french press or drip.  It's what we call 'omni-grind' which is suitable for all styles of filter coffee, (e.g. cafetiere, drip, V60, Aeropress), but unfortunately we don't advise using it in espresso machines. That said, we're always learning, so we'd love to hear any feedback!

I'm not happy - can I get a refund?
We offer a no-fuss refund and return policy, lasting 30 days - drop us a line at hello@grind.co.uk. To be eligible for a return, your item must be unopened, unused and in the same condition that you received it. We reserve the right to withhold any refund at any time.

Bottomless? Prosecco?
Uh-huh. From 11am-5pm, you can enjoy bottomless prosecco or bloody marys for 90 minutes for £15 - when also purchasing something to eat from our brunch menu and it’s fine if not everyone in your group wants to join in with the bottomless brunch.
If you’re unable to make your booking through our website, give the Grind you'd like to visit a call and they’ll be more than happy to try and accommodate you.

If you’re looking to enjoy our bottomless brunch and celebrate a special occasion with a large group, we have our private dining space in our Clerkenwell Grind which can fit a minimum of 18 and a maximum of 32 guests. With use of this space we offer an all-inclusive menu of £35/head + service charge for bottomless Prosecco and a sharing style brunch for the table. For more information please email events@grind.co.uk and someone will reach out to you to discuss further!

Bookings
We can take bookings of up to 4 guests at Covent Garden Grind, 8 guests at London and Exmouth Market Grind and 12 guests at Liverpool Street, Greenwich and Clerkenwell Grind. We are sometimes able to make exceptions, so if you’re unable to make your booking through our website, give the Grind you'd like to visit a call and they’ll be more than happy to try and accommodate you.

Can I hire the recording studio at Shoreditch Grind?
Totally, get in touch at studio@grind.co.uk

Can my dog come to Grind with me?
You’re more than welcome to bring along your dog to our Greenwich Grind - but we’d recommend ringing ahead on 020 3823 6545, just to give the team a heads up. For all of our other locations with outside seating, you’re more than welcome to bring your dog along, but unfortunately they just won’t be able to come inside the restaurant.

Do you have disabled access at Grind?
Our Clerkenwell, Greenwich, Liverpool Street, London and Whitechapel locations are disabled access friendly - but if you have any concerns or questions ahead of your visit please feel free to reach out to the teams directly, you’ll find the numbers to all of our Grinds here.

What’s a Grind Card? How do I use it?
The Grind Card works much like any other loyalty card, except without the stamps and scraps of paper. You can pick one up in any Grind - once you've registered here you’ll be ready to start earning points. You'll earn 1 point for every coffee or cocktail - once you reach ten, you can redeem them for a coffee or cocktail on us.

settings.richText:
Bring the Grind to you with coffee and cocktails from the Grind truck, served by our mobile baristas and bartenders. 

Whether your events are for twenty people or 2,000, we can serve coffee, cocktails and Espresso Martinis from the Grind mobile coffee van. We use the same equipment, coffee beans and milks as we use in our stores, and the same highly trained SCA certified team members as in our own London locations such as Soho, Shoreditch and Whitechapel.

A simple setup, we bring along everything we need for the event in the truck. All we require is a 32 AMP power point and tap for water nearby. Our events are fully health and safety compliant, and fully insured.

settings.blendOneText: We serve the Grind House Blend every day across London in all of our locations, in all of our coffees with milk. Our House Blend pods are designed to emulate as closely as possible the taste of the coffee in our locations, tweaked for best results with your Nespresso machine. With notes of chocolate and hazelnut, the Grind House Blend cuts through milk to deliver a proper coffee punch.
settings.blendTwoText: If you're an espresso or a long black drinker - you'll already know our Light Blend. Like our House Blend, we roast it ourselves in London and serve it thousands of times each week in our locations across the capital. Our Light Blend pods are designed to work best without milk. It’s a little lighter than the Grind House Blend, with lighter floral notes to match that heady caffeinated kick.
settings.blendThreeText: An old-school dark roast, packing a real punch.
settings.blendFourText: If you take your coffee decaf - you'll already know our Decaf Blend. Like our House Blend, we roast it ourselves in London and serve it hundreds of times each week in our locations across the capital. Our Decaf Blend pods are designed to give the same Grind espresso kick, just without the caffeine.

settings.columnOneText: Two recyclable bags, each packed full of enough ground or whole bean coffee for a refill of your Grind tin.
settings.shapeTextOne: Sourced and roasted by us, our coffee is 100% organic, certified by the Soil Association.
settings.columnTwoTextFirst: When you're done, don't recycle, refill instead. Subscribe to letterbox friendly refills, delivered for free. Amend, pause or cancel your subscription any time.
settings.columnTwoTextSecond: Subscription orders and orders over £18 are always shipped free in the UK.

settings.ctaOneSummary: Try Grind at Home. Get a refillable tin of compostable coffee pods for Nespresso® machines, whole bean or ground coffee.
settings.ctaTwoSummary: Subscribe & Save. Get refills for your tin in recyclable, letterbox-friendly packaging, with free UK delivery.
settings.ctaThreeSummary: Doing Good. Compostable pods and boxes, filled with organic coffee sustainably sourced from small farms, roasted by Grind.

settings.title: Gift a Grind Subscription.
settings.summary: We've everything you need to give the gift of coffee this Christmas. Gift someone special a subscription to Grind coffee, and we'll send them coffee every month for up to a year.

settings.blendOneText: We serve the Grind House Blend every day across London in all of our locations, in all of our coffee’s with milk. Our House Blend pods are designed to emulate as closely as possible the taste of the coffee in our locations, tweaked for best results with your Nespresso machine. With notes of chocolate and hazelnut, the Grind House Blend cuts through milk to deliver a proper coffee punch.
settings.blendTwoText: If you're an espresso or a long black drinker - you'll already know our Light Blend. Like our House Blend, we roast it ourselves in London and serve it thousands of times each week in our locations across the capital. Our Light Blend pods are designed to work best without milk. It’s a little lighter than the Grind House Blend, with lighter floral notes to match that heady caffeinated kick.
settings.blendThreeText: If you drink your coffee decaffeinated - you'll already know our Decaf Blend. Like our House Blend, we roast it ourselves in London and serve it hundreds of times each week in our locations across the capital.
settings.shapeTextOne: No idea how they like their coffee? Doesn't matter! They'll pick from compostable coffee pods, whole bean, or ground coffee as part of redeeming the subscription.
settings.shapeTextTwo: Our pods are certified compostable, compatible with your Original style Nespresso® machine.
settings.shapeTextThree: All of our coffee is certified organic and ethically sourced from sustainable farms around the world.
settings.columnTwoTextFirst: All gift subscriptions are shipped for free for the lifetime of the subscription.
settings.columnTwoTextSecond: If you'd like to make a bulk order or order for your company, just drop us an email.

settings.title: Serving two million cups a year, we know how to make a morning. ☕
settings.text:
We’ve been making coffee in our London cafés for almost a decade, and today we serve over two million a year. We've squeezed every drop of our coffee crafting expertise into our compostable pods for Nespresso® machines. 

A pod might never be quite as good as the real thing, but we think our Nespresso compatible pods are pretty damn close.

settings.title: Help us help the planet. 🌍
settings.text: Plastic and aluminium coffee pods are laying waste to our planet, with almost 30 billion pods finding their way to in landfill each year. Grind coffee pods are compostable and 100% plastic-free. When composted, they'll break down in weeks - but even in landfill they'll break down hundreds of times faster than their plastic cousins. Great coffee, doing good by the planet.

settings.text: What are you waiting for?

settings.mastheadSubTitle: For those of you who don't know us very well, here's a little low-down on all things Grind. ☕

settings.title: Where it all began.
settings.text:
Grind was founded in 2011 when David Abrahamovitch took over his father’s Shoreditch mobile phone shop and enlisted his old friend Kaz James to help him turn it into a coffee shop. In the decade since, Grind has grown to become a cult coffee brand with locations across London; including espresso bars, cocktail bars, restaurants, an international-grade recording studio, and a state-of-the-art coffee roastery.

Growing up.
Still based in Shoreditch, we now employ around two-hundred people and the majority of our investors over the years have been our Grind regulars and friends across the world.

For further press enquiries please contact us at grind@wcommunications.co.uk

settings.title: Grind at Home.
settings.text:
Grind at Home lets you bring Grind coffee home - all the way from our state-of-the-art coffee roastery in Bermondsey, London. Our coffee is sourced from across the world at better-than-Fairtrade prices, and the range, and all its packaging is compostable or recyclable. 

The latest addition to the collection are our compostable Nespresso® pods, named by Which?™ magazine as a ‘Best Buy’ product, having been the UK’s very first completely compostable coffee pods. Our Nespresso® compatible coffee pods are made entirely from bio-plastic and when composted, they'll break down in weeks.

Grind serves around two million cups of coffee each year, and a cup of our coffee is now enjoyed at home every five seconds. In addition, our friends at Soho House serve millions of cups of Grind coffee each year to their members around the world. Grind at Home can also be found in Selfridges, Ocado and Holland & Barrett.

settings.title: What do we mean by 'doing good'?
settings.text:
At Grind, we think great coffee can be a force for good. We work closely with sustainable farms around the world to source coffee directly from the farmers.

With our organic coffee packed into compostable capsules, we're doing good by our farmers and doing good by the planet. It's coffee with a clear conscience.

settings.title: Roasted by Grind, in London.
settings.text:
Every one of our coffees is grown with care and traded with compassion. From our London roastery, we source some of the best coffees in the world, and roast them to maximise flavour.

Most of our coffee goes out to our cafés across London, and we send the rest to our friends and subscribers around the world.

settings.title: Funded by our Customers.
settings.text:
We're an independent company based in Shoreditch, London - not an evil offshore empire. We're proud to pay our taxes in the UK, and to have created employment for more than 150 people in London.

We make long-term decisions, putting sustainability and quality first, and we're owned by our regulars, who have supported our growth through three record breaking rounds of crowdfunding.

settings.page_title: Win The Carry-On from Away and a six-month subscription to Grind.
settings.introduction: We’ve teamed up with travel brand Away to offer you the chance to win The Carry-On, one of their iconic cases. We thought it’d be fun to fill a suitcase with our compostable coffee pods and it was. Guess how many we managed to pack in (and yes, we did count them all) for a chance to win the suitcase and a six-month subscription to the Grind coffee of your choice.*

settings.passport_text: We’d all love to be sipping cocktails somewhere hot this summer, but as going away is still pretty tricky, we wanted to bring the holiday to you. Pick up a Grind passport at one of our locations and get free stuff when you visit Grind over the summer.

settings.title: Introducing Grind One
settings.content_body: Introducing our very own pod machine, designed to get the best from our compostable Nespresso® pods and inspired by the Italian espresso machines we use every day in our London cafés.
settings.selling_point_content_1: With 19 bars of pressure, it's designed to make the most of our compostable coffee pods for Nespresso® machines.
settings.selling_point_content_2: it's built to last - an antidote to the mass-market plastic machines that seem destined for landfill.
settings.selling_point_content_3: With 19 bars of pressure, it's designed to make the most of our compostable coffee pods for Nespresso® machines.

settings.testimonial_quote: The most sustainable Pods you can buy.
settings.testimonial_subtitle: Soil association certified 100% organic coffee, sourced and roasted by Grind in London. 0% plastic and 100% vegan.

settings.title: Great coffee, doing good.
settings.text:
Thanks for listening to In Good Company and choosing to find out a little more about Grind. 

As an independent business we’ve helped over 100,000 people make better, more sustainable coffee at home. 

You can enjoy Grind at home with our compostable pods for Nespresso® machines, whole bean, or ground coffee.
Use the code INGOODCOMPANY and get 25% off your first three deliveries, a free Grind tin and free delivery when you subscribe.

settings.title: Serving two million cups a year, we know how to make a morning. ☕
settings.text:
We’ve been making coffee in our London cafés for almost a decade, and today we serve over two million a year. We've squeezed every drop of our coffee crafting expertise into our compostable capsules for Nespresso® machines. 

A capsule might never be quite as good as the real thing, but we think our Nespresso® compatible capsules are pretty damn close.

settings.title: Help us help the planet. 🌍
settings.text: Plastic and aluminium coffee capsules are laying waste to our planet, with almost 30 billion pods finding their way to in landfill each year. Grind coffee capsules are compostable and 100% plastic-free. When composted, they'll break down in weeks - but even in landfill they'll break down hundreds of times faster than their plastic cousins. Great coffee, doing good by the planet.

settings.title: Organic & Sustainable. 🌿
settings.text: All of our coffee is certified organic by the Soil Association. We source our beans directly from smallholders around the world - empowering them to grow their farms, invest in their communities and continue to farm some of the best coffees in the world.

settings.title: Best of the Best.
settings.text: We're a Which? Best Buy, and  rated Excellent on Trustpilot.🥇

settings.imageOneText:
Our capsules are completely compostable,
with no nasty plastics.
settings.imageTwoText:
All of our coffee is certified
organic by the Soil Association.
settings.imageThreeText:
Subscribe to letterbox-friendly
refills for your tin.

settings.title: What do we mean by 'doing good'?
settings.text:
At Grind, we think great coffee can be a force for good. We work closely with sustainable farms around the world to source coffee directly from the farmers.

With our organic coffee packed into compostable capsules, we're doing good by our farmers and doing good by the planet. It's coffee with a clear conscience.

settings.imageOneText:
"Much tastier than Nespresso and
better for the environment - very happy."

- James B
settings.imageTwoText:
"The coffee is delicious and the pods
are biodegradable, what's not to love?"

- Stephanie M.
settings.imageThreeText:
"Love their coffee - a compostable
alternative to Nespresso. So good!"

- Sam L.

settings.title: Roasted by Grind, in London.
settings.text:
Every one of our coffees is grown with care and traded with compassion. From our London roastery, we source some of the best coffees in the world, and roast them to maximise flavour.

Most of our coffee goes out to our cafés across London, and we send the rest to our friends and subscribers around the world.

settings.title: Funded by our Customers.
settings.text:
We're an independent company based in Shoreditch, London - not an evil offshore empire. We're proud to pay our taxes in the UK, and to have created employment for more than 150 people in London.

We make long-term decisions, putting sustainability and quality first, and we're owned by our regulars, who have supported our growth through three record breaking rounds of crowdfunding.

settings.title: Select your Blend.
settings.text:
We source the Grind House Blend to taste great with milk, but it tastes great without too - we serve it every day across London.

With a subscription, switch your refills between our House Blend, Light Blend, Dark Blend and Decaf Blend whenever you like.
